intro: Silene macropoda, commonly known as the broad-leafed catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it produces capsules as its fruit. Silene macropoda is often found in moist, well-drained soils and blooms from late spring to early summer.
